com.android.dumprendertree2

Class FileFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.android.dumprendertree2.FileFilter

  • public class FileFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility to filter out some files/directories from the views and tests that run.

        public void loadTestExpectations()

      • isCrash

        public boolean isCrash(java.lang.String testPath)
        Checks if test is expected to crash.

        Path given should relative within LayoutTests folder, e.g. fast/dom/foo.html

        Parameters:
        testPath - - a relative path within LayoutTests folder
        Returns:
        if the test is supposed to be skipped

      • isFail

        public boolean isFail(java.lang.String testPath)
        Checks if test result is supposed to be "failed".

        Path given should relative within LayoutTests folder, e.g. fast/dom/foo.html

        Parameters:
        testPath - - a relative path within LayoutTests folder
        Returns:
        if the test result is supposed to be "failed"

      • isSlow

        public boolean isSlow(java.lang.String testPath)
        Checks if test is slow and should have timeout increased.

        Path given should relative within LayoutTests folder, e.g. fast/dom/foo.html

        Parameters:
        testPath - - a relative path within LayoutTests folder
        Returns:
        if the test is slow and should have timeout increased.

        public static boolean isTestFile(java.lang.String testName)

      • getUrl

        public static java.net.URL getUrl(java.lang.String relativePath,
                                  boolean allowHttps)
        Return a URL of the test on the server.
        Parameters:
        relativePath -
        allowHttps - Whether to allow the use of HTTPS, even if the file is in the SSL directory.
        Returns:
        a URL of the test on the server

      • setPathEnding

        public static java.lang.String setPathEnding(java.lang.String relativePath,
                                             java.lang.String newEnding)
        If the path contains extension (e.g .foo at the end of the file) then it changes this (.foo) into newEnding (so it has to contain the dot if we want to preserve it).

        If the path doesn't contain an extension, it adds the ending to the path.

        Parameters:
        relativePath -
        newEnding -
        Returns:
        a new path, containing the newExtension
